üáÆüá≥ India News.title: Smoke billows along LoC areas of Rajouri-Poonch on 2nd day also
üáÆüá≥ India News.summary: A massive forest fire erupted along the Line of Control in Rajouri and Poonch districts on Sunday, with dense smoke billowing up. The blaze, likely originating from across the border, is spreading rapidly due to dry conditions and has triggered multiple landmine blasts in forward areas without any reported injuries.

üáÆüá≥ India News.title: Vande Mataram debate: NDA, opposition trade barbs over national song; Bengal poll takes centre stage
üáÆüá≥ India News.summary: A special parliamentary discussion on 150 years of Vande Mataram became a platform for political sparring ahead of the Bengal assembly elections. While the ruling party highlighted the song's legacy and attacked the Congress, the opposition accused the BJP of using the debate for poll prospects.

üáÆüá≥ India News.title: Vande Mataram debate: From PM Modi to Priyanka Gandhi what leaders said - key points
üáÆüá≥ India News.summary: Lok Sabha witnessed a heated debate on the national song 'Vande Mataram' on its 150th anniversary. The BJP accused the Congress of disrespecting the song and appeasing the Muslim League, while the opposition alleged the ruling party was politicizing it for electoral gain and distracting from key issues.

üåç World News.title: Japan struck by earthquake, tsunami: Several injuries reported, thousands advised to evacuate; what we know so far
üåç World News.summary: A powerful 7.6 magnitude earthquake rocked northern Japan, triggering a tsunami of up to 70 centimeters and prompting evacuations for tens of thousands. Several injuries were reported, with fires breaking out in Aomori. Authorities have formed an emergency task force and are conducting safety checks on nuclear plants, which have shown no issues so far.

üåç World News.title: Why undoing the EU combustion engine ban spooks car rentals
üåç World News.summary: Europe's auto industry awaits a crucial EU announcement on December 10, potentially delaying the 2035 combustion engine phase-out amid industry pressure. Carmakers and fleet operators are pushing for concessions, citing market realities and infrastructure challenges, while the EU considers strict EV quotas for rental and leasing companies.

üåç World News.title: Unknown volcano eruption claimed as cause of Black Death
üåç World News.summary: A 1345 volcanic eruption likely triggered a climate crisis, causing crop failures and forcing European port cities to open new trade routes with Central Asia. This shift, researchers suggest, inadvertently facilitated the Black Death's arrival in Europe via the bacterium Yersinia pestis. The study combines historical records with ice core and tree ring data.

üåç World News.summary: 10 people living in one condo in Silicon Valley: Steve Bannon says H-1B 'scam' can't be reformed

üí∞ Business.title: India-US trade talks: US deputy ambassador for trade to visit India; discussions resume this week
üí∞ Business.summary: US Deputy Ambassador for Trade, Rick Switzer, is set to visit India on December 10-11 for crucial trade talks. Both nations aim to finalize a fair and mutually beneficial bilateral trade agreement, with discussions progressing significantly. This visit is expected to further these efforts, building on previous rounds of negotiations and a shared goal of boosting bilateral trade.

üí∞ Business.title: 8th pay commission: Govt shares major update in Lok Sabha after ToR notification; what‚Äôs next for employees and pensioners
üí∞ Business.summary: Over 50 lakh Central government employees and 69 lakh pensioners will be covered under the 8th Pay Commission, with its Terms of Reference notified on November 3, 2025. The commission, headed by Justice Ranjana Prakash Desai, will examine pay, allowances, and pensions. Implementation timelines and funding will be decided later, following the commission's submission of recommendations within 18 months.

üí∞ Business.title: IndiGo crisis: Rs 827 crore refunds, 1,800+ flights operated; slow recovery explained in key numbers
üí∞ Business.summary: India's largest airline, IndiGo, is recovering from a week of unprecedented disruption caused by new pilot duty norms. The crisis led to mass flight cancellations, stranded passengers, and significant financial losses, with over Rs 1,396 crore refunded. The government has imposed fare caps to stabilize prices.

üí∞ Business.title: Digital dominance: UPI tops global real-time payments with 49% share; govt tells Lok Sabha
üí∞ Business.summary: India's UPI has cemented its position as the world's largest retail real-time payment system, handling nearly half of global transactions. This remarkable achievement, highlighted by IMF and ACI Worldwide reports, underscores India's digital payment prowess. Government initiatives like incentive schemes and the PIDF have significantly boosted adoption, especially among small merchants, further expanding the digital ecosystem nationwide.

üí∞ Business.title: US market today: Wall street holds near record highs; Warner Bros bidding war lifts stocks ahead of Fed decision
üí∞ Business.summary: US stocks traded near record highs as investors awaited the Federal Reserve's interest rate decision. Major movers included Warner Bros. Discovery, which jumped on a takeover bid, and Confluent, acquired by IBM. Carvana and others were added to the S&P 500, driving their stock prices higher.

üèè Sports.title: Exclusive | 'Mango, Paneer, & ...': Not just chess on Russian GM's mind as GCL makes India debut
üèè Sports.summary: Russian Grandmaster Volodar Murzin, the 2024 FIDE Rapid champion, is set to compete in the Global Chess League in Mumbai. He expressed his fondness for Indian cuisine, particularly mangoes, paneer, and sugarcane juice. Murzin also shared his confidence boost after winning the World Rapid title and his ambition to improve his classical chess game.

üèè Sports.title: IPL 2026: What CSK need and who they should target in the auction
üèè Sports.summary: Chennai Super Kings enter IPL 2026 at a crossroads, carrying both legacy and last-place disappointment. Major trades, including Jadeja and Curran‚Äôs exit and Samson‚Äôs arrival, signal a new direction. With gaps in finishing, spin and pace, CSK head into the auction with a big purse and urgent needs as they prepare for life beyond MS Dhoni.

üèè Sports.title: 'We gave Sanju opportunities': Samson to get dropped from XI again?
üèè Sports.summary: Shubman Gill and Hardik Pandya return to India's T20I squad for the South Africa series, impacting the middle order. Despite Sanju Samson's good form, captain Suryakumar Yadav confirmed Gill will open, with Samson batting in the middle. Jitesh Sharma's recent performance also intensifies competition for middle-order spots.

üèè Sports.title: Praggnanandhaa becomes first Indian to qualify for Candidates 2026
üèè Sports.summary: Indian chess prodigy R Praggnanandhaa has earned a coveted spot in the Candidates 2026 tournament by triumphing in the FIDE Circuit 2025. His stellar year, marked by victories in major events, secures his sole male representation for India. Seven participants are confirmed, with one remaining spot to be decided by rating.

üèè Sports.title: Hardik Pandya inches toward history: Indian all-rounder on cusp of major T20I milestone
üèè Sports.summary: Hardik Pandya is on the verge of a significant T20I milestone, needing 140 runs for 2,000 and just two wickets for 100. Returning from injury, he proved his fitness and is a key player for India's T20 World Cup preparations. The five-match series against South Africa begins December 9.

üß¨ Science.title: Mars‚Äô largest river systems revealed: Insights into ancient water, sediment deposits, and potential habitability for past life
üß¨ Science.summary: Ancient Mars once teemed with flowing rivers, forming vast drainage systems. A new study has mapped these large basins, revealing they concentrated nutrients and sediments, making them prime locations for potential past life. These findings are crucial for guiding future missions in the search for evidence of ancient Martian habitability.

üß¨ Science.title: Harvard professor claims 3I/ATLAS emits a ‚Äòheartbeat‚Äô-like pulse that could signal alien technology
üß¨ Science.summary: Comet 3I/ATLAS has already puzzled astronomers with its odd trajectory, twin tails and sudden bursts of activity. Now a rhythmic 16.16-hour ‚Äúheartbeat‚Äù has become the latest mystery. Most researchers see a rotating, venting comet. Harvard astrophysicist Avi Loeb argues the pulse points instead to jets driving the brightness ‚Äúlike a bloodstream‚Äù, keeping open, cautiously, the possibility of something more engineered.

üß¨ Science.title: 6 things NASA wants you to know about the new Sentinel-6B sea-level satellite
üß¨ Science.summary: India's coastal communities stand to benefit from Sentinel-6B, a new satellite launched to monitor sea levels. This vital data aids in storm forecasting, infrastructure protection, and planning for vulnerable areas. A collaboration between NASA and international partners, the mission provides crucial insights into ocean changes, enhancing public safety and national security.

üß¨ Science.title: Mysterious deep-sea ‚ÄòBloop‚Äô had scientists convinced they‚Äôd finally found the giant Megalodon
üß¨ Science.summary: A mysterious underwater noise recorded in 1997, the ‚ÄúBloop,‚Äù fuelled years of speculation about megalodon and other undiscovered giants. But NOAA‚Äôs long-running investigation eventually traced the sound to Antarctic icequakes, not a living creature. The finding reveals less about ancient sharks and more about a warming planet, whose shifting ice now produces noises once mistaken for monsters.

üß¨ Science.title: 'Aliens need to be a lot smarter to reach out to us...': Ex-Nasa Astronaut Mike Massimino
üß¨ Science.summary: The astronaut also gave a straightforward reponse to the viral question circulating on social media on whether or not "can people have sex in space?" "I don't see why not," he said with a smile.
